subject: testing generated code: recommended oracles? or docs?
msgSnippet: I write code-generating wizards. I ve been working on making my tests drive UIs (both mine and the UIs which invoke mine); fortunately there are several
messageBody:
I write code-generating wizards. I've been working on making my tests
drive UIs (both mine and the UIs which invoke mine); fortunately there
are several packages which extend JUnit to do this. I can also
evaluate my "generands" (things which get generated--neologism modeled
on "generant"), but I feel my homebrewed oracle is kinda kludgey.

Are there any oracle packages for JUnit that are standard, widely-used,
or which you would recommended? If so, please lemme know, and feel
free to reply to me directly as well as to the group. I'd also
appreciate pointers to good docs on oracles and the more general topic
of testing generated code.
